title: NBA.package
text: Load example data use variouse functions create NBA plots. 1. bar plot  2. donut plot  3. Combined bar plot  4. RLI plot  5. NBA ggplot theme
code: NBA_example_thr_data <- NBA_example_thr_data   bar_plot <- NBA_plot(NBA_example_thr_data,                   `OVERALL types`,                   2:5,                  CHRT = "bar",                  NUM = TRUE,                  LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem types",                 SAVE = NULL)  bar_plot NBA_example_pro_data <- NBA_example_pro_data   donut_plot <- NBA_plot(NBA_example_pro_data,                   `OVERALL types`,                   2:5,                  CHRT = "donut",                  NUM = TRUE,                  LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem types",                  GRP = F,                 SAVE = NULL)  donut_plot NBA_example_pro_data <- NBA_example_pro_data NBA_example_thr_data <- NBA_example_thr_data NBA_example_comb_data <- NBA_example_comb_data   bar_plot_comb <- NBA_plot_comb(                NBA_example_comb_data,                 GROUPS= `OVERALL types`,                 METRIC_COL = metric,                METRICS = c("protection_level", "threat_status"),                 COLS = 3:10,                 CHRT = "bar",                 NUM = FALSE,                LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem",                 SAVE=NULL)  bar_plot_comb NBA_example_RLI_data <- NBA_example_RLI_data   RLI_plot <- RLI_plot(NBA_example_RLI_data,                  Years,                   RLI,                   min,                   max)  RLI_plot library(ggplot2) NBA_example_pro_data <- NBA_example_pro_data   gg_plot <- ggplot(NBA_example_pro_data, aes(x = `OVERALL types`, y = `Well Protected`))+   ggplot2::geom_point()+   NBA_theme()  gg_plot

title: NBA.package
text: Please note designed render html outputs may appear correct vignette examples. 6. Basic table 7. Coloured table 8. gt table theme
code: tbl <- NBA_tbl(NBA_example_pro_data)  tbl library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tidyr)  tbl <- NBA_example_pro_data %>%    pivot_longer(2:5, names_to = "protection_level") %>%    NBA_colr_tbl(COL = protection_level)  tbl library(gt) library(dplyr)   gt_tbl <- NBA_example_thr_data %>%    gt() %>%    NBA_gt_theme()  gt_tbl

title: NBA theme package
text: goal NBA.package allow graphs/ plots/ maps created NBA created easily targeted functions enable ease use standardisation results.

title: NBA theme package
text: can install development version NBA.package GitHub :

title: NBA theme package
text: data standard format groups/variables (e.g. Functional ecosystem types/ taxa) listed first column, threat status/ protection level ect categories subsequent columns. need totals column. extra columns problem, long columns mentioned. three example datasets package can use references (NBA_example_bar_plot, NBA_example_RLI_plot, NBA_example_donut_plot) well list possible names used categories columns (NBA_categories), please pay attention spelling cases functions case sensitive.

title: NBA theme package
text: find issues package functions, suggestions improvements package please go git repository log issue can dealt .

title: NBA theme package
text: can cite package like “tables figures produced using NBA.package R package (Besseling et al., 2024)”. full bibliographic reference include reference list (don’t forget update ‘last accessed’ date): cite package ‘NBA.package’ publications use: Besseling N, Bull L, Monyeki M, Hendricks S, von Staden L (2024). “Package creation NBA.” NA, 1(1), 1. doi:10.5281/zenodo.15310061 https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15310061. title: NBA map function — NBA_map
text: NBA maps protection level, threat status, condition. function can take dataset either one polygon multipolygon per ecosystem (row unique ecosystem) multiple rows per ecosystem type.

title: NBA map function — NBA_map
text: DF data frame contains information COLS variables group together ecosystem types data already form one row per ecosystem type. GEOM name geometry column CAP caption map (place bottom left plot) FILL column contains categories colour ecosystems (e.g. protection level, threat status, condition)

title: NBA map function — NBA_map
text: Returns map

title: NBA map function — NBA_map
text: function expects sf object. Please look example data NBA_example_map_data NBA_example_donut_plot see correct structure data. name fill column irrelevant, categories must spelled correctly (list standard spellings/ cases NBA categories named NBA_categories package, can accessed reference).

title: NBA plot function — NBA_plot
text: NBA plots protection level, threat status, condition. function expects groups column, one group per row, protection level, threat status, condition categories headings column. Please look example data NBA_example_bar_plot NBA_example_donut_plot see correct structure data. Please note datasets structure, whether used make bar donut plot irrelevant. function plot data either bar donut plot depending require. can also decide want donut plot split ecosystem functional group choose want number ecosystems displayed within plot.

title: NBA plot function — NBA_plot
code: NBA_plot(   DF,   GROUPS,   COLS,   CHRT = c("bar", "donut"),   NUM = FALSE,   LAB,   GRP = TRUE,   SAVE = NULL )

title: NBA plot function — NBA_plot
text: DF data frame contains information GROUPS categorized variables (ecosystem functional group, taxa, etc) COLS categories describe variables (protection level, threat status, condition, etc). can use tidyselect method select columns e.g. 2:4/ Endangered:Vulnerable/ c(Well Protected,Moderately Protected,Poorly Protected,Protected) etc CHRT choice either "bar" "donut" plot NUM choice show numbers plot, False show numbers LAB x axis label plot GRP choice whether plot donut graphs group, TRUE plot donut plot group. SAVE name output file saved output folder. outputs folder prompted make one.

title: NBA plot function — NBA_plot
text: Returns plot

title: NBA plot function — NBA_plot
text: name groups column irrelevant, categories must spelled correctly (list standard spellings/ cases NBA categories named NBA_categories package, can accessed reference).

title: NBA multi plot function — NBA_plot_comb
text: NBA plots multiple plots protection level, threat status, condition grid. function expects groups column, one group per row, protection level, threat status, condition categories headings column. Please look example data NBA_example_bar_plot NBA_example_donut_plot see correct structure data. Please note datasets structure, whether used make bar donut plot irrelevant. function plot data either bar donut plot depending require. can also decide want donut plot split ecosystem functional group choose want number ecosystems displayed within plot.

title: NBA multi plot function — NBA_plot_comb
code: NBA_plot_comb(   DF,   GROUPS,   METRIC_COL,   METRICS,   COLS,   CHRT = c("bar", "donut"),   NUM = FALSE,   LAB,   GRP = TRUE,   SAVE = NULL )

title: NBA multi plot function — NBA_plot_comb
text: DF data frame contains information GROUPS categorized variables (ecosystem functional group, taxa, etc) METRIC_COL column differentiates rows belong plots METRICS list identifiers plot COLS categories describe variables (protection level, threat status, condition, etc). can use tidyselect method select columns e.g. 2:4/ Endangered:Vulnerable/ c(Well Protected,Moderately Protected,Poorly Protected,Protected) etc CHRT choice either "bar" "donut" plot NUM choice show numbers plot, False show numbers LAB x axis label plot GRP choice whether plot donut graphs group, TRUE plot donut plot group. SAVE name output file saved output folder. outputs folder prompted make one.

title: NBA multi plot function — NBA_plot_comb
text: Returns plot

title: NBA multi plot function — NBA_plot_comb
text: name groups column irrelevant, categories must spelled correctly (list standard spellings/ cases NBA categories named NBA_categories package, can accessed reference). nameing plots automatically alphabetical lower case. ordering plots also automatic. legend assumed added bottom plots.

title: RLI_plot — RLI_plot
text: function create line graph indicating Red list index per period/year. Additionally, depending graph requirements creates multiple line graph grouping plot according species, creates buffer parallel RLI line using minimum maximum values. Note: graph can used datasets well, long contains data structure Red List Index. example dataset (NBA_example_RLI_plot), available users reference needed.

title: RLI_plot — RLI_plot
code: RLI_plot(DF, YEAR, RLI, min, max, GRP = FALSE)

title: RLI_plot — RLI_plot
text: DF data frame contains information Red List Index YEAR years RLI Red List Index min minimum values max maximum values GRP choice group plot, TRUE group , FALSE .

title: RLI_plot — RLI_plot
text: Returns RLI plot

title: RLI_plot — RLI_plot
code: test <- RLI_plot(NBA_example_RLI_data, Years, RLI, min, max)
